meanings.definition: A point where two or more things are joined
meanings.sent1: At the junctions of the puzzle pieces, the picture starts to come together.
meanings.sent2: The junctions of the pipes were securely welded to prevent leaks.
meanings.sent3: The junctions of the Lego blocks created a colorful tower.
meanings.sent4: The junctions of our ideas formed a strong bond of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The junctions of the train tracks were crucial for smooth transportation.

meanings.definition: A place where roads or railway lines meet and cross
meanings.sent1: We stopped at the busy junctions to let the traffic pass.
meanings.sent2: The junctions in the city center were always bustling with cars and pedestrians.
meanings.sent3: The junctions resembled a chaotic dance of vehicles moving in different directions.
meanings.sent4: The junctions were like the beating heart of the city, connecting all its parts.
meanings.sent5: The junctions were painted with colorful lines to guide drivers on the road.

meanings.definition: A connection or intersection between two things
meanings.sent1: The junctions between the two rivers created a beautiful natural landscape.
meanings.sent2: The junctions of the internet cables were carefully organized to ensure fast connections.
meanings.sent3: The junctions of the tree branches made it look like they were holding hands.

meanings.sent5: The junctions of the wires were neatly arranged to avoid any confusion in the system.
